intro: Capparis sepiaria var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth caper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and features small, waxy leaves that are smooth to the touch, distinguishing it from other varieties of Capparis. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that are often followed by small, round, edible berries. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional cuisines.
